subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Are radio waves necessary?
author: SnowfireL@aol.com

Hi Zack, I do get FM, the spirits, however I do not get AM for Spirits,  
t=
hey use the FM, but it zips so fast there are no radio strays anymore, only=
  
hissing and or the voices.  They must be really working hard getting the=
se  
radios going on the FM, are you able to hear any of the files I just p=
osted  
Zack?   I'd like to get a Franks Box with the metal tube in it Fran=
k,  when 
will you be selling one again?  Please let me know I'd like to bu=
y one  
from you, they seem to have less static.  I did get a bit of AM ear=
ly this  
morning, i asked them if the FM is better for them I got the word=
s, "a lot" 
from  this one guy spirit. It's just certain times late when I =
get some AM, but 
they  tell me they like the FM better.  When I get the ti=
me and money, I 
will get  my ante fixed, and find a way to attach it, I co=
uld probably get 
even better  files maybe. sf
 
 
In a message dated 7/11/=
2010 1:37:35 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
w9sz.zack@... writes:

 
 =

 
My guess is there is something wrong with your radio. Those things shoul=
d  
not be stopping you from receiving FM and AM transmissions.
 
Zack


On=
 Sat, Jul 10, 2010 at 11:55 AM, <_SnowfireL@..._ 
(mailto:SnowfireL@aol=
.com) >  wrote:


 
 
 


Since i live rural, i wonder if my property being=
 next  to a small private 
lake, and across the road about 1/4 mile is the =
tower for  Altel now Verison 
on the north west side, and same distance on =
the other  side is ATT, they 
are south east of me, then down further is an=
other ATT  tower, and plus my 
big antennae on the roof, i wonder if that's=
 help them  come through on my FM 
RS 20-125 radio's, I don't even hear rad=
io signal on  them anymore, even on 
the FM channel, it's weird, and can't =
get any AM's  either, AM's only give 
me this funny ringing noise, but the =
FM gives me  static or them talking, I 
sure wish i could buy one of those =
fancy boxes  Franks has bet I'd be a 
boomin over here!  hint hint.,  sf


=

 


-----Original Message-----
From: Zack Widup <_w9sz.zack@gmail.w9s_ (ma=
ilto:w9sz.zack@...) >
To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com) 
Sent: Sat, Jul 10, 2010  10:11 am
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A=
re radio waves necessary?


 
 
 
 

My take on it is that the spirits or w=
hatever they are are capable  of 
using whatever methods are placed in fron=
t of them. DVR's get EVP. I've  gotten 
EVP on the sound tracks of a video =
recorder. The radio and ITC seems  to 
generate a different class of commun=
ication. EVP-Maker is another  one.
 
Probably the method of actually produ=
cing the sound waves is  different for 
each device.
 
Zack


On Sat, Jul 1=
0, 2010 at 8:20 AM, John S <_phenom_investigatorphenom_inv_ 
(mailto:phenom=
_investigator@...) > wrote:


 
 
 

 
Raymond Bayless was getting re=
corded spirit voices back in the  1950's.
While his best known work was wit=
h von Salazy on audio tape,  Bayless
also received voices using an early gr=
ammophone-also received voices using 
an e
In other words, he was using str=
ictly a mechanical recorder. This  would
suggest that the voices may not re=
quire electronics at all. And that  would
imply that radio signals may have=
 nothing to do with the voice  reception.
 
Consider too that EVPMAKER sess=
ions seem to work well for some  people.
Except for the mechnical recording=
s, which are few in number, all  the
current techniques have electronics in=
 common. So it would make  sense
that electronics might be important to the=
 process. However,  when 
you factor in the mechanical recordings made usin=
g devices prior to  
modern electronics, it seems more sensible to look for=
 a common 
explanation which involves environmental manipulation. The most =
 reasonable
thing we know of that meets this criterion is mind-matter  inte=
raction,
or psychokinesis (PK).
 
The only remaining question then, aside f=
rom the actual source of the  
information which cannot be objectively asce=
rtained as of yet, is  whether
a single or multiple mechanisms are indeed a=
t work. Even though radio  
waves 
are not required to produce the phenomen=
a, if multiple mechanisms are  at 
work, 
it may be that radio waves are on=
e of many ways the phenomena is  produced.
 
Bottom line, with so many opti=
ons much more information is needed to  form 
any
reasonable hypothesis.
 
=
